questions.question: Match each term to its correct definition.

pairs.word: fixed-size unit processed by the CPU

questions.question: Which statement is correct?
options: Binary prefixes scale by 1000
Decimal prefixes scale by 1024
Binary prefixes scale by 1024, decimal prefixes scale by 1000
Both binary and decimal prefixes scale by 1024
questions.answer: Binary prefixes scale by 1024, decimal prefixes scale by 1000

questions.question: Match each binary-prefix unit to its equivalent size.
Which statement best describes file compression?
options: Storing data without any encoding changes
Reducing file size by encoding data more efficiently
Encrypting files to protect from unauthorized access
Converting files into a human-readable format
questions.answer: Reducing file size by encoding data more efficiently

questions.question: Which option correctly contrasts lossy and lossless compression?
options: Lossy removes some information; lossless preserves all information
Lossy preserves all information; lossless removes some information
Both remove some information
Both always preserve all information
questions.answer: Lossy removes some information; lossless preserves all information

questions.question: Match the compression type to a common application.

pairs.Lossy compression: Multimedia where some data can be discarded

questions.question: What are the main benefits of file compression?
options: Increased file quality and enhanced security
Faster upload or download, reduced bandwidth costs, and efficient storage use
Better file organization and improved readability
Enhanced compatibility and format conversion
questions.answer: Faster upload or download, reduced bandwidth costs, and efficient storage use

questions.question: Lossless compression is essential for:
options: Streaming music
Archiving files in ZIP format
Medical documents
Both B and C
